line_1: The chilling frost his tender form had seiz'd,
line_2: But Phoebus' beams the captive swain releas'd,

line_1: His Eyes a silky Slumber seiz'd,
line_2: Or would have done, if Pug had pleas'd:

line_1: Till by the soft oppression seiz'd,
Each as he came th' infection seiz'd,
line_2: And by his friend behind was teaz'd

line_1: Straight with Convulsive Transports he was seiz'd
line_2: At the Surprize, alarm'd, disturb'd, and pleas'd.

line_1: I saw the tempting food, and seized —
line_2: And, in the pilfer'd treasure pleased,

line_1: For they're most Patient who the most are seiz'd.
line_2: Ev'n with this Gust of Passion I am pleas'd;

line_1: And swift the envied station seiz'd;
line_2: At length the Kite the Eagle pleas'd,

line_1: Once more the furies on her heart have seized,
Once more the furies on her heart have seized,
line_2: But still she views the youth who all her sufferings eased.

line_1: Nor spleen, nor passion, on me seiz'd:
line_2: By cares nor crosses was I teaz'd,

line_1: Her fav'rite Son the Volume seiz'd;
line_2: And, as he read, seem'd highly pleas'd;
